RmBayesSonarModel.cpp

00001 // RmBayesSonarModel.cpp
00002 
00003 #include <assert.h>
00004 #include "RmBayesSonarModel.h"
00005 #include "RmExceptions.h"
00006 
00007 /*
00008  * Region I (Eqs 11.1, 11.4, 11.6):
00009  * - prSnGivOcc = ( ((R - r) / R) + ((BETA - alpha) / BETA) ) / 2 * maxOccupied;
00010  * - priorPrOccGivSn = m_prGrid[gridCoord.x][gridCoord.y]
00011  * - prSnGivEmp = 1 - prSnGivOcc
00012  * - priorPrEmpGivSn = 1 - priorPrOccGivSn
00013  * 
00014  * Region II (Eqs 11.2, 11.4, 11.6):
00015  * - prSnGivOcc = ( 1 - [( ((R - r) / R) + ((BETA - alpha) / BETA) ) / 2] ) * maxEmpty
00016  * - priorPrOccGivSn = m_prGrid[gridCoord.x][gridCoord.y]
00017  * - prSnGivEmp = 1 - prSnGivOcc
00018  * - priorPrEmpGivSn = 1 - priorPrOccGivSn
00019  * 
00020  * Where:
00021  * - prSnGivOcc = P(Occupied) in Eq 11.1/2, P(s|H) in Eq 11.3, and P(s|Occupied) in Eq 11.4
00022  * - priorPrOccGivSn = P(H) in Eq 11.3, P(Occupied) in Eq 11.4, and P(H|s_{n-1}) in Eq 11.6
00023  * - prSnGivEmp = P(Empty) in Eq 11.1/2, P(s|~H) in Eq 11.3, and P(s|Empty) in Eq 11.4
00024  * - priorPrEmpGivSn = P(~H) in Eq 11.3, P(Empty) in Eq 11.4, and P(~H|s_{n=1}) in Eq 11.6
00025  * - maxOccupied = 0.98
00026  * - maxEmpty = 0.50 (or 1.0, historically)
00027  * - resulting cell value = 
00028  *   prSnGivOcc * priorPrOccGivSn / ( prSnGivOcc * priorPrOccGivSn + prSnGivEmp * priorPrEmpGivSn )
00029  */
00030 
00031 
00032 float RmBayesSonarModel::prOccupiedGivenSn( 
00033         float priorPrOccGivSn, Region region, double r, double alpha ) const
00034 {
00035         char buff[30];
00036         if ( region != RegionI && region != RegionII ) {
00037                 sprintf( buff, "Region specification must be %d or %d; is %d", RegionI, RegionII, region );
00038                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( 
00039                         "RmBayesSonarModel::prOccupiedGivenSn()", buff );
00040         }
00041         if ( r < 0 || r > R ) {
00042                 assert( false );
00043                 sprintf( buff, "Range reading of %.0f is outside bounds of [0..%.0f]", r, R ); 
00044                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( 
00045                         "RmBayesSonarModel::prOccupiedGivenSn()", buff );
00046         }
00047         if ( alpha < 0 || alpha > m_settings->Beta ) {
00048                 sprintf( buff, "Alpha of %.2f is outside bounds of [0..%.2f]", alpha, m_settings->Beta );
00049                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( 
00050                         "RmBayesSonarModel::prOccupiedGivenSn()", buff );
00051         }
00052 
00053         // It is possible that a cell will have obtained a probability of occupancy of 1.0
00054         // and that the cell will later be on the outer boundary of Region I, such that
00055         // alpha = BETA and r = R.  In this event, the below formula will become
00056         //      0.0 * 1.0 / ((0.0 * 1.0) + (1.0 * 0.0)) = 0 / 0 = Undefined
00057         // In this event, it doesn't seem reasonable that the probability should fall from
00058         // 1.0 to 0.0 in one iteration.  Therefore bring in r a bit, which actually leaves
00059         // the resulting pr unchanged, at 1.0, for this example.
00060         if ( r == R && alpha == m_settings->Beta ) r -= 0.0001f;
00061 
00062         float prSnGivOcc = prSnGivenOccupied( r, alpha, region ); // P(s_n|H)
00063         float prSnGivEmp = 1 - prSnGivOcc; // P(s_n|~H)
00064         float priorPrEmpGivSn = 1 - priorPrOccGivSn; // P(~H|s_{n-1})
00065         
00066         float pr = (prSnGivOcc * priorPrOccGivSn) / 
00067                 ((prSnGivOcc * priorPrOccGivSn) + (prSnGivEmp * priorPrEmpGivSn));
00068 
00069         return pr;
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 float RmBayesSonarModel::prSnGivenOccupied( double r, double alpha, Region region ) const
00074 {
00075         // P(s_n|H) for
00076         //              Region I = [(R - r) / R + (Beta - alpha) / Beta] / 2 * Max_{occupied}
00077         //              Region II = 1 - P(s_n|~H)
00078 
00079         // NOTE: this formula doesn't account for the cell's distance from the sonar reading,
00080         // so that probabilities increase as r approaches 0, regardless of how far from the
00081         // sonar the cell is.  This doesn't agree with the pictured sonar model,
00082         // where the range reading is shown at the peak of a 3-d gaussian hill over Region I.
00083 
00084         if ( r < 0 || r > R ) 
00085                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenOccupied( r )" );
00086         if ( alpha < 0 || alpha > m_settings->Beta ) 
00087                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenOccupied( alpha )" );
00088         if ( region != RegionI && region != RegionII ) 
00089                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenOccupied( region )" );
00090 
00091         float pr;
00092 
00093         switch ( region )
00094         {
00095                 case RegionI:
00096                         // In the original equation, alpha is not multiplied by any factor
00097                         // Doing so here will often produce a negative result, so need to adjust for it
00098                         pr = ( ((R - r) / R) + 
00099                                 ((m_settings->Beta - (alpha * m_settings->AlphaFactor)) / m_settings->Beta) ) / 2 
00100                                 * m_settings->MaxOccupied;
00101                         if ( pr <= 0 ) pr = 0.0001f;
00102                         break;
00103 
00104                 case RegionII:
00105                         pr = ( 1 - prSnGivenEmpty( r, alpha, region ) ) * m_settings->MaxEmpty;
00106                         break;
00107         }
00108 
00109         return pr;
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 float RmBayesSonarModel::prSnGivenEmpty( double r, double alpha, Region region ) const
00114 {
00115         // P(s_n|~H) for 
00116         //   Region I = 1 - P(s_n|H)
00117         //   Region II = [(R - r) / R + (Beta - alpha) / Beta] / 2
00118 
00119         if ( r < 0 || r > R ) 
00120                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenEmpty( r )" );
00121         if ( alpha < 0 || alpha > m_settings->Beta ) 
00122                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenEmpty( alpha )" );
00123         if ( region != RegionI && region != RegionII )
00124                 throw RmExceptions::InvalidParameterException( "prSnGivenEmpty( region )" );
00125 
00126         float pr;
00127 
00128         switch ( region )
00129         {
00130                 case RegionI:
00131                         pr = 1 - prSnGivenOccupied( r, alpha, region );
00132                         break;
00133 
00134                 case RegionII:
00135                         // In the original equation, alpha is not multiplied by any factor
00136                         // Doing so here will often result in a negative result, so need to adjust for it
00137                         pr = ( ((R - r) / R) + 
00138                                 ((m_settings->Beta - (alpha * m_settings->AlphaFactor)) / m_settings->Beta) ) / 2;
00139                         if ( pr <= 0 ) pr = 0.0001f;                            
00140                         break;
00141         }
00142 
00143         return pr;
00144 }
